attributes.action: ensure a 4.7% pay rise consistently for all occupational groups
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Pay is expected to increase by an average of just over 3% in the UK next year, half the predicted figure for other countries across the world. If the UK is the fourth richest country in the world - why is this ?

AOl today reports that ,
"A study of 62 countries by consultants Mercer showed that global salaries were expected to rise by 6.1% in 2008, 1.9% above the rate of inflation." The petitioner is calling on the P.M. to ensure that despite predictions, his administration will endeavour to ensure 
that pay should rise by 4.7% in Ireland, compared with 3.1% in the UK, said the report.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
